content: Write a sonnet about mountains in the style of Robert Frost.

Mountains stand, unmoving, through the years,
Their peaks in snow, their bases in the earth.
They see the seasons change, the sun and tears,
And yet they stand, unchanging, without mirth.

The traveler climbs their slopes, with toil and sweat,
To reach the summit, where the view is wide.
But when he turns to look back, he is met
With the same mountains, standing side by side.

They are the sentinels of time and space,
The witnesses to history's march.
They see the rise and fall of human race,
And yet they stand, unmoving, without starch.

So let us learn from mountains, firm and strong,
To stand our ground, through life's uncertain song.
